title: Introducing: Novella
content:
It might be wishful thinking, but it sounds like the haze that’s covered one hell of a lot of musical releases over the last few years might be lifting.

Underneath that cloying pall we can find the likes of London/Brighton quartet Novella, three girls and one boy making a stargazing grungy racket, exemplified by the likes of Don’t Believe Ayn Rand, lead track from their forthcoming EP. …Ayn Rand showcases a distinct step forward from the band’s previous releases, sharpening their fidgety beats and roiling distortion, and adding a hook so big it has its own gravitational pull. It’s effortlessly cool, but it’s still kind of approachable.

Novella are due to release their eponymous EP via Italian Beach Babes on March 19th. You can find the dates for their March tour with Veronica Falls below. You can also keep track of them on their website.
